channel.title: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables
channel.description:
Allan Jardine is the creator of [DataTables](https://datatables.net/), a popular jQuery plugin. We discuss his challenges and successes as he learned how to make a viable business from creating Open Source software.
We also discuss Allan’s new SaaS product, [CloudTables](https://cloudtables.com/).
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/2d02b9e4-3f61-4669-a820-a6bb1bbbe77a?dark=false"></iframe>
You can also [listen, download, and subscribe here](https://bootstrapped.fm/166-making-an-open-source-business-work-with-allan-jardine-of-datatables/).

item.title: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables
item.dc:creator: unboot
item.description:
Yes, handsontable looks dangerous for a bootstrapper. I’m not sure I’m clear on the implications of their licenses.

Read full topic
item.source: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables

item.title: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables
item.dc:creator: gravelld
item.description:
Handsontable looks pretty slick but the pricing page is verging on frightening. Not for the cost, but for the subtle hostility. Doesn’t feel like a tool a bootstrapper could integrate.

Another not-spreadsheet but in the same universe is Slickgrid (and its forks).

Read full topic
item.source: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables

item.title: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables
item.dc:creator: theallan
item.description:
@Roland_Finke Hi Roland! Good to see you here . Not yet, but we are aiming for a preview of it towards the end of this month.

@Lbjstetson Thank you. That’s awesome to here!

@unboot DataTables has its KeyTable addition which can make it a bit like a spreadsheet, when combined with Editor, for input. But we don’t attempt to be a spreadsheet - DataTables is intentionally kept to being “just” a table. For a more spreadsheet like operation (formula etc) try Handsontable.

Allan

Read full topic
item.source: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables

item.title: #166: Making an Open Source business work with Allan Jardine of DataTables
item.dc:creator: Lbjstetson
item.description:
Just wanted to say that the DataTables plugin is great. I had it up and running on my tables in about 20 minutes. My customers seem to love it so far.

image1763×605 51.8 KB
